intro: Sauvagesia alpestris, commonly known as the alpine sauvagesia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pink flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes with limited soil. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to withstand cold and harsh weather conditions. Sauvagesia alpestris is often found in open meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in horticulture.
